description: Jack-in-the-pulpit (Arisaema triphyllum) is truly an amazing plant. It produces unusual, skittle-like flowers, which are accompanied by hooded leaflets. These lovely leaflets, when combined with its pitcher-shaped spathe, give this plant its bright and captivating appearance. Its root system is also noteworthy; a single plant can produce a vast underground root system, up to an impressive 5 metres across. Jack-in-the-pulpit enjoys wet, shaded areas and can be found in woodlands throughout much of North America. A truly majestic and stunning species, it deserves all the attention it can get!
